[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/slh_dsa_sha2_128s.rs] [Lines: 1-115] [Boundary Conditions] Does the benchmark test maximum-size messages, keys, and signatures to ensure proper handling of edge cases? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/slh_dsa_sha2_128s.rs] [Lines: 1-115] [Backward Compatibility] If SLH-DSA is added to Aptos, how will backwards compatibility be maintained with existing Ed25519 signatures, and could mixed-signature blocks cause validation issues? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/slh_dsa_sha2_128s.rs] [Lines: 1-115] [BCS Serialization] Are SLH-DSA signatures properly integrated with Aptos's BCS serialization format, or could serialization inconsistencies cause verification failures across nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/slh_dsa_sha2_128s.rs] [Lines: 12] [Derive Macros] Do the cryptographic derive macros (CryptoHasher, BCSCryptoHash) work correctly with SLH-DSA message types, or could macro expansion bugs introduce vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/slh_dsa_sha2_128s.rs] [Lines: 79-90] [Key Memory] Is private key memory properly zeroed after use, or could keys remain in memory accessible through memory dumps or side-channel attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/benches/slh_dsa_sha2_128s.rs] [Lines: 8] [Algorithm Binding] Are signatures cryptographically bound to the SLH-DSA-SHA2-128s algorithm identifier, or could signatures be reinterpreted as different algorithm types? (High)
